item.title: Lambda Expressions
item.description: Lambda expressions are not unknown to many of us who have worked on other popular programming languages like Scala. In Java programming language, a Lambda expression (or function) is just an anonymous function, i.e., a function with no name and without being bounded to an identifier. They are written exactly in the place where itâ€™s needed, typically as a parameter to some other function. The most important features of Lambda Expressions is that they execute in the context of their appearance.
